page.title: 07LOCAL EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Mr Strawford is a{self-employed {builder.}He works in and around Apperley. Building is not the only thing he does; all the trades usually sub-contracted are performed by himself. He concerns himself mostly with farms, usually obtaining his equipment & materials from nearby towns. Ben Weston moved to Apperley in 1922, gaining a{County Council farm}for serving in the First World War. In 1962 he died and his only son took over. In 1982 he gave up the farm to become a{small holder}and an {agricultural contracter.}Now his work involves hedgelaying, haymaking, fencing and on Mondays he has a regular job at{Gloucester}Market.He owns 15 acres of land which is used for producing hay and breeding fat lambs for meat.
